column4: I need some help. I can't get X running after I manually built my kernel.
what'd you do with the kernel?
added alsa/oss directly into the kernel and changed my processor make. I'm an avid gentoo user, so I'm fairly familiar with kernel config
i'm assuming there were no obvious errors during the compile?
none to speak of
what kind of errors are you getting now when X fails?
something about nvidia. let me retry to get something specific
failed to load the NVIDIA kernel module!
do you have an nvidia card?  or is the error all the more interesting for your lack of said hardware?
7800 GS OC
whenever I set the system up last night, I just let the package manager install the drivers, and everything worked until after I compiled the kernel today (to add x-fi support... don't even ask)
i've never compiled a kernel, myself, but it occurs to me that the nvidia driver is a binary blob; what are the chances it didn't get linked in properly?
pretty high. how do I like external modules back into the kernel? in gentoo, its modules-rebuild
not quite sure off the top of my head
looks like modprobe will do it for the current session
k, that's a start
modprobe didn't quite fix it. is there anyway to reinstall all of my binaries?
all of your binaries?  like, the entire install?
I managed to fix my issue by commenting out the nvidia line in xorg.conf. I'll fix that later, haha
ha! well, whatever gets it limping along for now, huh?
I use gentoo, my systems are always broken XD
